image.altText: Man speaking in front of microphones to a group of people

props.synopsis: Independent MP David O'Byrne has said he will support a no-confidence motion against treasurer Michael Ferguson when parliament resumes on Tuesday.

title.children: No confidence motion against embattled Tasmanian treasurer Michael Ferguson likely as David O'Byrne delivers decisive blow

image.altText: A man in a dark blue coat holds two 3D printed animated seahorses, while smiling.

props.synopsis: It took "so many iterations" to make anatomically correct 3D-printed seahorses, but staff at Tasmania's Seahorse World are hailing the collaboration with a local business as a win for visitors with low vision.

title.children: New 3D-printed aids mimic the feel of real seahorses for tourist site visitors with low vision

image.altText: An artist's impression of a new ferry wharf

props.synopsis: A trial passenger service between Hobart and Bellerive has proven so successful that a permanent ferry terminal is being proposed.

title.children: Indoor waiting area, bicycle storage part of newly released designs for upgraded Bellerive ferry wharf

image.altText: Cradle Mountain with Dove Lake in the foreground

props.synopsis: A 22-year old tourist has been assisted near Cradle Mountain, after attempting to climb the mountain sans footwear. It's prompted a reminder from police about the need to be properly prepared in the wilderness.

title.children: Hiker provided with assistance, and shoes, after attempting to climb Tasmanian mountain without them

image.altText: Di standing in front of photos of Aboriginal lands rights activists.

props.synopsis: Di Spotswood, one of eight people elected last month to the Aboriginal Land Council of Tasmania, says it is a "continual fight" with the state government to negotiate land returns.Â

title.children: 'We need more of our land back': Eight First Nations people elected to manage Aboriginal-owned land in Tasmania

image.altText: Two men in glasses hold the pregnant tummy of a smiling woman sitting between them surrounded by flowers and greenery.

props.synopsis: Joel Reeve is eagerly awaiting the birth of his son after a stranger he met online agreed to be a surrogate. But he had to move his entire life to Tasmania to become a father.

title.children: Joel will soon be the first single man in Tasmania to have a child through surrogacy

image.altText: A man pauses for a portrait in front of a map

props.synopsis: The few people remaining in Lebanon's south make the same dire prediction about Israel's bombardment and ground offensive against the militant group Hezbollah.

title.children: 'Same scenario as in Gaza': Lebanese mayor fears he's seen his town's future

image.altText: A graphic of a torn ticket over an image of concert-goers

props.synopsis: Inside a Ticketmaster transaction, there are hidden and public fees that are filtered back to parent company Live Nation. But how much is really being charged, and for what?

title.children: Who's your concert ticket really paying? The global music giant angering both bands and fans

image.altText: A boy stands in a doorway while a police car with flashing lights is parked outside.

props.synopsis: Claire thought that she'd escaped domestic violence after leaving her abusive partner, but she then struggled to find help with the violent meltdowns from her trauma-affected son.

title.children: Did you miss? ð£ How to help a child with violent meltdowns â a mother's journey for support after domestic violence

image.altText: Israeli soldiers enter a military helicopter at night

props.synopsis: The UN peacekeeping mission in southern Lebanon says Israeli tanks "forcibly entered" one of its positions on Sunday, as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu demanded it leave the area. Follow live.

title.children: Hezbollah drones evade Iron Dome to hit Israeli military camp, IDF tanks 'forcibly' enter UN peacekeeper base

image.altText: Burney wears a traditional possum skin cloak, standing on the lower house floor.

props.synopsis: On the first anniversary of the failed Voice referendum, Linda Burney â the minister responsible for delivering the vote â wants to set the record straight.

title.children: Burney on why Albanese backed the Voice vote even as support crumbled

image.altText: Anthony Albanese frowns during a press conference.

props.synopsis: Rather than a National Apology-style watershed moment, today's anniversary of the failed Voice to Parliament referendum is one that many Indigenous people and the more than 6 million who voted Yes want to forget.

title.children: A year ago today Albanese's post-election honeymoon ended â and the government has never recovered

image.altText: Woman with blonde and black sweater stands on busy street at night, the background action blurred

props.synopsis: Someone spent years plastering deepfake porn of Hannah Grundy online. It was a betrayal that turned her life upside down.

title.children: Hannah found deepfake porn of herself online. But the most disturbing revelation was still to come

image.altText: A large construction fence in front of a large empty grass block of land on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Complex state planning laws and allegations that Woolworths and Coles are hoarding blocks of land to keep competitors out are facing further scrutiny from the ACCC as it investigates the country's concentrated supermarket sector.

title.children: Woolworths pounced when this block of land went up for sale. A decade on, there's no supermarket in sight

image.altText: A nurse standing in a hospital hallway pulls off her shower cap while dressed in full PPE

props.synopsis: Thousands of patients caught COVID in NSW public hospitals last year and hundreds died, fuelling concerns among infection control experts that hospitals are not taking strong enough precautions against airborne viruses.

title.children: Thousands caught COVID in NSW hospitals last year, hundreds died, new data shows

image.altText: Bruce Lehrman leaves the Federal Court of Australia in Sydney 150424

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann's battle to appeal against findings in his failed defamation case against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson will face a critical challenge in the Federal Court today.Â

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann faces critical challenge in bid to appeal against findings of failed defamation case

image.altText: A Polynesian man smiles as he speaks to a NRLW player as two white Australian men look on at a footy field

props.synopsis: A potential deal that would see Australia provide $600 million to help set up an NRL side in Port Moresby includes an assurance no security deal with China is signed by the Pacific nation, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: $600 million deal to help PNG's NRL team bid may hinge on promise to avoid security pact with China

image.altText: Smoke is emitted from a large silver cylinder as it hangs from two large metal prongs on a launch tower.

props.synopsis: SpaceX pulled off its boldest test flight yet of the enormous Starship rocket on Sunday, catching the returning booster back at the launch pad using a tower dubbed "Mechazilla".

title.children: In engineering feat, SpaceX's mechanical 'arms' successfully catch Starship rocket booster back at launch pad

image.altText: Dozens of hens with glossy brown feathers and red plump combs under a clear blue sky.

props.synopsis: Biosecurity, environmental funding for protected native species and a top-up of the national stockpile of flu vaccines are part of preparations for the arrival of H5N1 to Australia.

title.children: Labor sets out $95 million to combat potential arrival of deadly bird flu strain H5N1

image.altText: A man standing at the side of a football oval

props.synopsis: Victorians abused in foster care have called a $20,000 compensation payment offered by the state government insufficient and unfair.

title.children: Victorians abused in foster care say state government compensation is insulting

image.altText: Hands holding phones at a social media summit.

props.synopsis: Government leaders, academics, advocates and teenagers met over two days to discuss the impact of social media and how to handle its effects in the future.

title.children: Two states came together to talk about how social media is impacting young people. Here's how it happened.

image.altText: Australian visa in a passport

props.synopsis: Australia's had a particular immigration strategy for decades, but it's in major need of repair.

title.children: It's wrong to say Australia hasn't had an immigration strategy for decades â we're living with its consequences

image.altText: Members of the Rebels motorcycle club

props.synopsis: Digital technology is changing how the underworld operates. According to a senior policeman, it's leading to younger crews with less experience stepping up and performing serious crimes and putting the public at risk.

title.children: How organised crime is using technology to carry out hits, distribute drugs from a distance

image.altText: Rally in Brisbane

props.synopsis: The protest was one of the largest seen in Brisbane since the Israel-Gaza war began a year ago.Â

title.children: Thousands of protesters in Brisbane call on federal government to demand ceasefire in Middle East

image.altText: A woman's hands holding a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Viral social media groups naming and shaming men on dating apps are being paused or shut down after a separate defamation case cost a Facebook administrator thousands in legal fees.Â

title.children: Sis, Are We Dating The Same Guy? Facebook groups paused as admins fear legal risks

image.altText: Brodie Kostecki and Todd Hazelwood hold a trophy

props.synopsis: Brodie Kostecki and Todd Hazelwood claim a terrific Bathurst 1000 victory, completing an unlikely comeback for Erebus Motorsport, which began the season marred in scandal.

title.children: Kostecki and Hazelwood win Bathurst 1000 in remarkable turnaround for Erebus Motorsport

image.altText: Hands holding phones at a social media summit.

props.synopsis: Government leaders, academics, advocates and teenagers met over two days to discuss the impact of social media and how to handle its effects in the future.

title.children: Two states came together to talk about how social media is impacting young people. Here's how it happened.

image.altText: Shot zoomed in on the top of the Bayswater coal-fired power plant, with its smoke stacks and high voltage power lines

props.synopsis: A remarkable first for coal power in Australia gave the beleaguered industry hope recently. But news this week might have snuffed it out again.

title.children: Can coal survive the solar spread? Major Australian power plant notches 'extraordinary' first

image.altText: A group people with a sign reading "white man fight back" near a stone cenotaph.

props.synopsis: Community leaders reject the "abhorrent" rally and reassure people Corowa is a safe multicultural community after a white supremacist rally in the centre of the border town.

title.children: Calls grow for NSW to ban Nazi salute, symbols after 'disgusting' rally in Corowa

image.altText: Senator James Paterson speaking in suit.

props.synopsis: The Coalition has outlined the conditions that would need to be met before it would support a ceasefire deal in the Middle East, acknowledging that its position is out of step with that of Australia's main ally, the United States.Â

title.children: Shadow home affairs minister says it is not 'remarkable' for his position on ceasefire in Gaza to differ to from Biden administration's

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a map pinned to the wall behind her.

props.synopsis: Just weeks before the US election, polls suggest the race between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump remains a dead heat. In the key battleground state of Arizona, abortion might be a deciding factor.

title.children: Trump is in trouble with female voters. How his vow to be their 'protector' landed in a swing state

image.altText: A police car is parked on the tram tracks beside a McDonalds with Flinders St station in the background.

props.synopsis: Police are searching for a man after the 44-year-old victim was hit over the head in Elizabeth Street in Melbourne.

title.children: A man who was critically injured in an assault in busy CBD street dies in hospital

image.altText: A grainy, dark picture of two young girls smiling, wearing warm caps.

props.synopsis: Libby German, 14, and her best friend Abigail Williams, 13, disappeared during a hike near their home town in Delphi, Indiana. Their killing would go on to garner international attention.Â

title.children: Libby German recorded her own killer. Now the man accused of murdering her and her best friend is on trial

image.altText: a woman next to a sign

props.synopsis: Youth crime rates have plummeted in Queensland despite claims from both major parties that the state is in the grip of a crisis.

title.children: Australia's youth crime rates have plummeted despite what politicians would have you believe
